sentence.Network_en: The area where most refugees are waiting is exposed to the elements.
sentence.Network_cn: 大多数难民等待救济的地方都不能挡风遮雨。

sentence.Network_en: "I have never knowingly exposed any patient to needless risks," he said.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说：“我从未故意将任何病人置于不必要的风险境地。”

sentence.Network_en: He has simply been exposed as an adulterer and a fool.
sentence.Network_cn: 有人揭发他就是个奸夫和白痴。

entry.tran: 暴露于风雨的;无遮蔽措施的
entry.def: If a place is exposed, it has no natural protection against bad weather or enemies, for example because it has no trees or is on very high ground.

example.tran: 康涅狄格一处暴露于风雨中的小山坡

example.ex: This part of the west coast of Scotland is very exposed to Atlantic winds.
example.tran: 苏格兰西海岸的这一段完全暴露在大西洋海风前。
